Data: Zampa to Roy, 1 run on the toes, tickled to midwicket
Zampa to Bairstow, 1 run stretching onto the front foot to defend
Zampa to Roy, 1 run a flashy drive, stretching onto the front foot and bashing through the line to mid-off
Zampa to Bairstow, no run stabbed defence on the front foot once more
Zampa to Bairstow, 2 runs back and across, whipped into the leg side, and Bairstow gallops back for a non-existent second. He's brisk!
Zampa to Bairstow, no run striding onto the front foot, and punched to cover
Tye to Roy, no run worked into the off side
Tye to Roy, no run ripping delivery, and there's a clear snick as the ball bounces through to the keeper! But no appeal at all, curious. Seemed to miss everything...

Tye to Roy, OUT battered high in the air, and Hazlewood circles at mid-on to gather a steepling miscue! The knuckleball does the trick, Roy was deceived by the change of pace, was through his shot too soon, and an aggressive if at times streaky innings comes to an end
Tye to Bairstow, 1 run tip and run and a single into the covers
Tye to Hales, no run solid defence outside off stump
Tye to Hales, 1 run nudged down to third man, Hales is up and running
Zampa to Hales, 1 run pushed to leg
Zampa to Bairstow, no run a big appeal but a touch too leg-sided to justify a decision
Zampa to Bairstow, no run poked back down the pitch, a touch of drift through the air to help the deception in flight
Zampa to Bairstow, no run nurdled out to the leg side
Zampa to Bairstow, no run back of a length but skidding through, Bairstow dances at the crease but can't find the gap
Zampa to Bairstow, 2 runs chopped through third man and they scamper back for the second
Tye to Hales, 1 run jabbed into the leg side
Tye to Bairstow, no run yorker, well directed, well dug out
Tye to Bairstow, 1 run clipped on the up and out through midwicket
Tye to Hales, FOUR runs checked drive, that is sweetly timed! Clean through mid-on, and that races to the rope
Tye to Hales, no run punched through the line once more, to mid-on
Tye to Hales, 1 run sweetly timed into the covers, picking the slower ball and guiding it into the gap
Zampa to Hales, no run worked off the pads to the leg side
Zampa to Hales, 1 run banged in short, and flashed up and into the covers
Zampa to Bairstow, 1 run a leg-sided long-hop, but he gets away with the drag-down, a yawning pull out to midwicket
Zampa to Hales, 1 run blocked into the covers
Zampa to Bairstow, 2 runs swept out through the leg side
Zampa to Bairstow, FOUR runs swept again and this time he nails it, into the gap behind square
Tye to Hales, no run tight line, steered into the covers
Tye to Hales, no run fuller length, tight to off stump again, solid defence
Tye to Hales, 1 run short and swiped out through the leg side
Tye to Bairstow, no run forward, punched to mid-off
Tye to Bairstow, FOUR runs nailed through the covers! Bairstow stretches onto the front foot, presents the full face, and fillets the two fielders to race to the rope
Tye to Bairstow, no run banged in short, no stroke offered
Maxwell to Hales, no run round the wicket, lobbed up and tapped towards mid-on
Maxwell to Hales, 1 run tossed up on the stumps, Hales waits and works one through square leg
Maxwell to Bairstow, no run dances in and pushes a flat delivery on off, YJB prods it back to the bowler
Maxwell to Bairstow, SIX runs oof, watch out by the sight screen! Boshed straight down the ground by Bairstow, leaping out to cream the ball for six - and that's the England 100 up, lickety-split
Maxwell to Bairstow, 1 run darted in and nudged away square for one
Maxwell to Hales, no run tossed up on the stumps, tapped back
Starc to Bairstow, no run over the wicket, hits a length around off, YJB pushes back down the track
Starc to Bairstow, no run good length, 138kph and punched on the up towards extra cover
Starc to Bairstow, no run angled across and Bairstow picks out a fielder in the covers again
Starc to Bairstow, no run full outside off, 140kph and clipped towards mid-off
Starc to Bairstow, SIX runs short ball, 145kph/90mph... and helped on it's way over the third man boundary! Bit of a wafty uppercut, Zampa was down there but never in the game
Starc to Bairstow, no run rapped on the pads, there's a shout for lbw - but Smith indicates it was maybe high and they don't review
Maxwell to Hales, no run flighted, comes across on off and taps to cover
Maxwell to Hales, no run dobbed on the stumps, tucked into the leg side
Maxwell to Hales, no run darted on off stump, pushed into the off side again
Maxwell to Hales, 2 runs touch short and Hales swats it through point, into a gap and they trundle back for a second
Maxwell to Hales, no run fired in and pushed away to the off side
Maxwell to Hales, FOUR runs makes a bit of room and whacks the ball through mid-off, gets it away for four - and England continue to motor at sixes, despite a tight over

Starc to Bairstow, OUT bowled 'im, YJB deflects the ball on to his stumps! Starc makes the breakthrough, pace and zip off the pitch and Bairstow prodded with a wonky bat, trying to run it behind point but only getting an inside edge on to leg stump
Starc to Root, no run full length, angled across at 145kph and Root has a flirt with it, a loose push to his first ball but he fortunately fails to connect
Starc to Root, no run straighter line, slung down full and blocked to leg
Starc to Root, 1 run pitched up outside off, Root eases a drive away through the covers
Starc to Hales, no run back of a length, Hales takes it on the body trying to play across the line
Starc to Hales, no run in the channel, rising sharply at 139kph and this one is left alone
Maxwell to Root, 1 run tossed up on middle and leg and nurdled through midwicket
Maxwell to Hales, no run over the wicket to Hales, who drops back and slaps a cut to backward point
Maxwell to Hales, 1 run pushed in towards middle and off stump, clipped down the ground
Maxwell to Root, 1 run drops a touch short and Root seizes on it, whirling a pull through midwicket
Maxwell to Hales, SIX runs FORE! Here comes Hales, more of a pitching wedge but it sails high and long down the ground into the vacant seats by the sightscreen
Maxwell to Hales, no run prodded back to the bowler

Starc to Root, 3 runs slightly full on the pads, swinging in as Root flicks across the line and sends the ball racing away into the vacant green acres - though we might get another all-run four there, but Root slipped slightly coming back for the third
Starc to Hales, 1 run drops short, Hales opens the shoulders and carves the ball square, Maxwell does well to get fingertips on it to keep them to one
Starc to Root, no run rising off a length, 139kph/87mph and pushed into the covers
Starc to Root, 1 run full and driven, Starc gets a fingertip on it in his follow through but can't quite divert it on to the stumps at the non-striker's end
Starc to Hales, 2 runs short ball, sits up like a nail to be hammered and Hales obliges, gets a couple in front of deep midwicket
Starc to Hales, no run fires in the yorker to finish, gets the bat down on it in time
Marsh to Root, FOUR runs strays on to the pads and Root skims his first boundary, leaves Hazlewood on his hands and knees at fine leg
Marsh to Root, no run good length, blocked on off stump
Marsh to Root, 1 run full, tailing in and nudged through midwicket for one
Marsh to Hales, no run length ball around fourth stump, 130kph and dabbed down square
Marsh to Hales, no run fuller, no width for Hales who defends towards cover
Marsh to Hales, no run comes across and blocks into the covers once more - solid over from Marsh
Zampa to Root, 1 run lobbed up outside off and steered through the covers
Zampa to Hales, no run dragged short and leg side but Hales misses out with a pull, hit on the knee roll
Zampa to Hales, no run floated up and drilled into the covers, where Steven Smith sticks out a velcro paw
Zampa to Hales, 1 run flighted, on the stumps and worked away through square leg
Zampa to Root, 1 run tossed up and pinged down the ground for one
Zampa to Hales, no run pushed through flat outside off, Hales sits in the crease and picks out backward point
Marsh to Root, no run fullish, tight stuff around off, Root pats it back
Marsh to Root, 1 run pitched up, 132kph and driven firmly, Marsh gets his left hand to it but only diverts the ball wide of mid-off and they take one
Marsh to Hales, no run length outside off, Hales steers it square but quickly decides against running
Marsh to Hales, FOUR runs dug in short, Hales pulls lazily at it... and top-edges clean over Paine's head, almost goes all the way!
Marsh to Hales, no run fired in, top of off stump, defended to the on side
Marsh to Hales, no run tight lines, as Grandmaster Flash didn't quite sing, 133kph and Hales is happy to defend
Zampa to Root, 1 run floated up in the channel and stabbed through cover for one
Zampa to Hales, no run full, leg-stump line, popped back to the bowler
Zampa to Hales, 1 run flat and wide of the stumps, Hales rocks back and slaps one down to wide long-off
Zampa to Root, 1 run full length, maybe the googly but it barely has the chance to pitch before Root stuns it through cover point - England raise the 150, looking in good order
Zampa to Hales, no run gets a bit of dip on this, Hales toe-ending the ball into the crease
Zampa to Hales, 1 run pushed through outside off and cut for a single to the sweeper

Marsh to Hales, OUT short ball, Hales tries to wallop it over square leg... but skews a top edge to point! Think that deflected off the helmet, Australia have used his head and Marsh breaks the stand. There's pace in this deck, seemed to surprise Hales and he top-edged it straight into the badge
Marsh to Morgan, no run length, angled across from over the wicket, Morgan defends
Marsh to Morgan, no run touch short, 141kph from Marsh, who's tail is up, Morgan is cramped for room and blocks on leg stump
Marsh to Morgan, no run fuller, pushed towards the slips, defended coming forwards
Marsh to Morgan, 1 run shortish and chopped through point for Morgan's first run
Marsh to Root, no run fired in straight at 140kph and Root can only deflect it to square leg
Hazlewood to Morgan, 1 leg bye slightly leg side, a length ball rolls away behind square off the pads
Hazlewood to Root, no run good length, 138kph and Root pushes to cover point getting on to the front foot
Hazlewood to Root, 1 run touch short and Root hops across to play his favoured back-foot drive through cover
Hazlewood to Morgan, no run angled across, Morgan walks out and drops down into the off side
Hazlewood to Morgan, no run length ball on off, 138kph and stroked towards mid-off, nice-looking shot but lacking placement
Hazlewood to Morgan, 1 run full and wide and clunked through the covers to the sweeper for one more
Marsh to Morgan, 1 run short, at the body, nudged away behind square

Marsh to Morgan, OUT this one carries, though - slashed over point and Stoinis takes a smart grab running in off the rope! Another low score in a poor series for the captain, he was trying to come down as Marsh dug in a 139kph delivery, Morgan off his feet as he swiped and perish in the deep
Marsh to Root, 1 run leg side, worked off the hip down to fine leg
Marsh to Buttler, no run short, 138kph outside off, Buttler drops the hands
Marsh to Buttler, 1 run Marsh is working the speed gun today, up at 140kph again as Buttler goes back and runs to third man
Hazlewood to Buttler, no run short from Hazlewood, outside off and Buttler swings and misses
Hazlewood to Buttler, no run back of a length in the channel, 138kph and left alone
Hazlewood to Buttler, 1 run drops back outside off and guides the ball to third man
Hazlewood to Root, no run good length, metronoming away in the channel, Root pushes square
Hazlewood to Root, 1 run dug in and Root pulls down to fine leg
Hazlewood to Buttler, 1 run angled in with the arm, 135kph and Buttler works a single through midwicket
Marsh to Buttler, no run banged in, good heat on this, 141kph as Buttler rolls the shoulders and turns his head away
Marsh to Buttler, 1 leg bye Buttler tries to come down, another short ball and it ricochets off his shoulder behind square on the off side
Marsh to Root, 1 run length, 137kph and sliding on to the pads as the batsman glances fine
Marsh to Buttler, 1 run short and wide, 142kph/88mph and slashed towards third man
Marsh to Root, 1 run dug in again, another single as Root swivels on a pull
Marsh to Buttler, no run fires the ball up towards the blockhole, and block is what Buttler does
Hazlewood to Root, 1 run length in the channel, stabbed through the covers for one, Root has to scramble for his ground
Hazlewood to Buttler, no run straightens a touch, hits a leading edge... and Hazlewood does well to grab it on the bounce diving forwards in his follow through
Hazlewood to Buttler, no run banged in, cross seam at 136kph and it b-o-i-n-g-s over Buttler's attempted pull, Paine stretching for the take
Hazlewood to Buttler, no run comes across his stumps to defend
Hazlewood to Buttler, FOUR runs short ball and collared for four! Buttler smokes a pull in front of deep midwicket to bring England a boundary, first since the 25th over
Hazlewood to Buttler, 1 run pitched up, taking the pace off, worked back fine of mid-on for one
Tye to Buttler, no run back of a length, arrow straight, defended back down the pitch
Tye to Buttler, no run clipped back down the pitch, half-stopped in the followthrough
Tye to Buttler, 1 run slashed out through the covers, quite high on the splice and in the air for a while

Tye to Root, no run climbing into the pull and thumped under the ribcage! Ouch, that's going to hurt. No dissimilar to Pietersen's cracked rib against McGrath in the 2006-07 tour. Hopefully no lasting damage on this occasion
Tye to Root, 1 wide off line
Tye to Root, 1 run dabbed into the off side and through they jog. Root can rest up at the non-striker's end for a moment
Tye to Buttler, 1 wide short, too short, over the shoulder and out stretch the umpire's arms
Tye to Buttler, 1 run tapped into the off side, Root was slow getting going, and Maxwell's shy slides past the stumps! A direct hit would have been very, very tight
Zampa to Buttler, 1 run tossed up, smacked with lots of bottom hand into the leg side
Zampa to Root, 1 run worked into the gap at mid-on for another single
Zampa to Buttler, 1 run clocked into the covers
Zampa to Root, 2 runs swept, picking the length early and placing it through backward square
Zampa to Root, 1 run thumped out through the leg side again
Zampa to Buttler, 1 run looped up and blocked to the off side
Tye to Buttler, SIX runs in the slot, and slotted over long-on! Power and placement
Tye to Buttler, 1 run tapped into the off side, another single to the cause
Tye to Root, no run tapped to cover, riding the extra bounce
Tye to Root, no run back of a length, rises sharply as Root rocks back into the pull but can't time the shot. Indicates that it is a bit two-paced
Tye to Root, 1 run swinging into the toes, and tucked behind square. A bread-and-butter single

Tye to Buttler, OUT full, and Buttler holes out to mid-off! That's a critical breakthrough for Australia, Warner back-pedals to complete the catch, and once again, Tye's slower ball draws out the miscue from a well-set batsman
Zampa to Ali, no run back of a length, worked to leg
Zampa to Ali, no run big stride, head over the ball
Zampa to Ali, no run blocked into the off side
Zampa to Ali, 1 run pushed into the gap at mid-on
Zampa to Root, 1 run squeezed into the off side
Zampa to Ali, no run dancing down the pitch, looking to be aggressive, and gathered at mid-off
Tye to Root, no run on the back foot, tapped into the off side
Tye to Root, no run flicked off the toes, mid-on intercepts
Tye to Root, 1 wide short, aggressive, but rather harshly judged as a wide,

Tye to Root, 2 runs another short ball, perhaps Root thought that was it for the over, but it doesn't get up, and a steepling top-edge lands safe! He got out in that fashion at Adelaide ... a key let-off, perhaps
Tye to Root, 1 run tucks the single to get off strike
Tye to Ali, 1 run full and straight, half stopped by the bowler in his followthrough but Moeen steals the single as the ball deflects to mid-off
Tye to Root, 1 run angled defence down to third man, another single picked off
Zampa to Root, 1 run a bottom-handed biff into the covers
Zampa to Ali, no run down on one knee, and nailed hard on the sweep, but square leg wears the shot to prevent the single
Zampa to Ali, 1 run nurdled to the leg side
Zampa to Root, no run onto the front foot, meeting the fuller length, and steered into the covers
Zampa to Root, 2 runs delicate flick over the shoulder from Root, reversing the hands to ramp-sweep the ball. Gathered with a slide by the chasing gully
Zampa to Root, 1 run dabbed out to cover
Starc to Root, 1 run round the wicket, whipped into the leg side
Starc to Ali, 1 run on the legs, Moeen this time works the single to square leg
Starc to Root, no run round the wicket, very full, attacking the base of the stumps and gathered at mid-on
Starc to Root, 1 run a round-house pull, out to deep midwicket
Starc to Ali, 1 wide down the leg side. Was there some bat or pad on that? Very tight to the body either way
Starc to Ali, 1 run flicked into the leg side, and dozy running from Moeen! Ball-watching as Smith's shy comes in from midwicket, and he'd have been gone with a direct hit
Starc to Root, 1 run eased down the ground to keep the strike
Zampa to Root, 1 run worked into the covers
Zampa to Ali, 1 run sensible nudge down to long-on
Zampa to Root, 1 run hauled out through square leg

Zampa to Ali, OUT that's a very soft dismissal from Moeen! Down the track, losing his shape, a wellied drive in the air to cover, and England's hopes of their habitual 300-plus total are looking bleak all of a sudden
Zampa to Root, no run worked out to the leg side
Zampa to Root, 2 runs back of a length, a languid pull out to deep midwicket
Starc to Rashid, no run full length, and defended back down the pitch
Starc to Rashid, no run round the wicket, angled into the right hander, and blocked to the off side
Starc to Rashid, FOUR runs banged in short, and that's cutely played, leaning back, upper-cutting through the gap at third man
Starc to Rashid, 1 run stabbed defence through third man
Starc to Root, 1 run width and slapped through third man
Starc to Rashid, 1 run on the pads, nudged round the corner
Zampa to Rashid, no run forward and blocked to the off side
Zampa to Rashid, 1 wide drifting down the leg side. But at least there is drift. Makes him a particular threat
Zampa to Rashid, no run leaning forward to defend
Zampa to Rashid, no run propping onto the front foot, good line and length
Zampa to Rashid, no run looking to attack, but Zampa has him under lock and key, no width to work with
Zampa to Rashid, 1 run slapped with lots of bottom hand over the covers
Zampa to Root, 1 run nudged into the leg side
Hazlewood to Root, 1 run short and hauled out through the leg side
Hazlewood to Rashid, 1 run pounded out to deep point
Hazlewood to Root, FOUR runs short and wide, slapped high and hard, and just eludes third man! The ball ricochets off the spreadeagled fielder and over the rope, and that is Root's fifty as well.
Hazlewood to Root, 1 run heaved out through backward square, Root gives it some bottom-handed heft
Hazlewood to Rashid, 1 run tapped through third man
Hazlewood to Root, no run flicked to the leg side
Tye to Rashid, no run low full toss, clipped to midwicket and Starc does well to save four overthrows as the shy comes in
Tye to Rashid, no run a dot-ball in the end, as Rashid gets in a tangle trying to manipulate the angles
Tye to Rashid, 3 runs a bottom-handed bunt inches short of long-on! Perfectly placed, in the end
Tye to Root, 1 run nudged off the hip
Tye to Rashid, OUT run out! Stabbed to point, and just the minutest hesitation does for Rashid, as a screaming shy from point plucks out the non-striker's poles!
Tye to Root, 1 run slower bouncer, pulled out to midwicket
Hazlewood to Root, 1 run short and pulled out through square leg
Hazlewood to Willey, no run tucked off the pads to the leg side
Hazlewood to Willey, no run back of a length, attempted glide through third man, but drops down into the crease instead
Hazlewood to Willey, 1 run worked down to fine leg
Hazlewood to Root, 1 run pulled out through the leg side
Hazlewood to Willey, no run tight wicket-to-wicket line, pushed back down the pitch, that's a fine containing over
Tye to Root, 1 run another cunning slower ball, tucked to midwicket
Tye to Willey, 1 run swatted, in the air, through the leg side
Tye to Root, 1 run bottom-handed biff to mid-on

Tye to Willey, OUT a mow over the leg side, and another catch in the deep! And was that another Tye slower ball? Certainly looked as though Willey was through his shot early, flapping the ball much squarer than he might have intended. This is a fine collective bowling effort from Australia, and England just can't get any momentum back into their innings
Tye to Root, 1 run flipped into the leg side
Tye to Tom Curran, 1 wide less exceptional this time, mind you...
Tye to Tom Curran, 1 run pounded out to the leg side with a cross-batted mow
Starc to Tom Curran, 2 runs round the wicket, makes room for a swipe over the covers, and gets some decent contact
Starc to Tom Curran, no run flicked out to midwicket
Starc to Tom Curran, no run stand and deliver, a mighty wipe in an ambitious direction over the covers, but no contact on this occasion
Starc to Tom Curran, SIX runs exceptional batting, planted over the keeper's head with a total inversion of the stance! Nailed it
Starc to Tom Curran, 1 run dancing at the crease again, but no effective contact this time
Starc to Root, 1 run short, pulled down into the leg side, Root scampers, and just beats the shy as it comes in from midwicket
Tye to Root, OUT smashed high and hard, but not high enough! In the slot once again, Root got underneath his shot, much like Roy before him, and picks out the man right back on the fence
Tye to Tom Curran, 1 run slapped into the leg side
Tye to Ball, no run well bowled, beats the edge with good carry through to the keeper
Tye to Ball, OUT well bowled! And that is five for Tye! Yorker, straight and true, rattles the timbers, and England's innings has come to an ignominious end

2.55pm So that's the end of that. England have a decent total on the board, but significantly less than they would have envisaged at 151 for 2 in the 26th over. But Andrew Tye's exceptional variations unpicked their set batsmen, and failed to let the new ones settle. After looking all at sea at 3-0 down, Australia are suddenly well placed to finish the series on a high. Back in 30 for the chase.
3.15pm: It's been a good half an hour for Andrew Tye - he's just been sold for $1.1m in the IPL auction

Right, shall we tango? England have more than they made in Adelaide to defend, but fewer than they would have wanted, given the start they made... David Willey, who knows his way around Perth, will start off to David Warner. Two slips in
Willey to Warner, 1 wide swing for Willey... although it starts wide of off and goes further, causing the umpire to signal wide
Willey to Warner, no run shifts his line across, 132kph and curving away nicely as Warner watches it through
Willey to Warner, no run angled in and straightening, stabbed towards point from the crease
Willey to Warner, no run good length, shaping in and then out in the channel at 134kph/82mph, Warner shoulders arms
Willey to Warner, 1 run this swings early, slightly short in length and dabbed through backward point from back in the crease for the first run of the reply
Willey to Head, no run curling away in the channel, an encouraging start for Willey, left alone

Willey to Head, FOUR runs full, swinging and clubbed to the rope! Head reaches out and batters Willey through the covers for the first four of the day, to beery cheers around the Perth Stadium... So much for encouragement
Tom Curran to Warner, 2 runs over the wicket, pitched up a touch too straight, 136kph and helped off the pads past mid-on for a couple
Tom Curran to Warner, 3 runs full outside off, shaping in a fraction but Warner just bullies it on the up, crunched past the dive at cover point for a couple
Tom Curran to Head, 4 leg byes strays on to the pads, Warner flicks at it and the ball diverts wide of Buttler, no bat involved

Tom Curran to Head, no run short and wide, slashed and he gets a thick edge - but Bairstow drops it at first slip! A dolly drop and Head gets a life, he was maybe distracted by Buttler moving across to his left but still should have held it
Tom Curran to Head, no run comes across and taps the ball away
Tom Curran to Head, no run full and punched towards mid-off
Willey to Warner, FOUR runs heaved over mid-off, Warner is away... Bit of width and he climbs into a lofted drive, bounces a few yards short of the rope
Willey to Warner, no run ah, good come back, swings it and finds the leading edge, falls short of cover
Willey to Warner, 1 run touch too straight and worked for one
Willey to Head, no run gets a bit square on and taps it away
Willey to Head, no run good length around off stump and Head shows it a straight bat
Willey to Head, no run short and hammered on the cut but picks out backward point, who stops it smartly
Tom Curran to Warner, FOUR runs drops short and POW, roundhoused through midwicket! Dismissive power from Warner, picks up four more
Tom Curran to Stoinis, no run down the leg side, there's a sound as it passes, Buttler takes the catch... flicked the pad
Tom Curran to Stoinis, no run length ball outside off, Stoinis gets into line and lets it go
Tom Curran to Stoinis, no run fuller, 135kph on off stump, punched to mid-off
Tom Curran to Stoinis, no run pitched up and again Stoinis come across and leaves
Willey to Head, 2 runs angled in, sliding on to the pads, Head flicks fine for a couple
Willey to Head, 2 runs again Willey gets a bit too straight and the ball doesn't swing, Head flicks a couple more
Willey to Head, no run full, Head unfurls a powerful on-drive but sends it to the man on the edge of the ring
Willey to Head, no run pitched up on off, middled on the drive to mid-off
Willey to Head, no run pitched up, 135kph cross seam now, giving up on swing and again it's drilled to mid-off
Willey to Head, no run tight lines, Head punches on the up but it rolls to mid-on this time and there's no run
Tom Curran to Stoinis, no run Curran plugs away outside off, Stoinis continues to pretend to be a proper batsman leave
Tom Curran to Stoinis, no run digs in the bouncer, think it maybe clipped the shoulder as he shrugged it off
Tom Curran to Stoinis, no run fullish and defended on the stumps
Tom Curran to Stoinis, FOUR runs pitched up but this is a half-volley on the pads and Stoinis opens his account with a wristy whack through square leg
Tom Curran to Stoinis, no run fired in straight and tapped back
Tom Curran to Stoinis, no run short, 129kph outside off, rocks on to the pull but sends it skimming straight to midwicket
Willey to Head, 2 runs short and wide from Willey and this is twocked into the ground past a leaping backward point, wide of third man for a couple
Willey to Head, no run full, outside off and Head lays into a drive but it's well stopped at cover
Willey to Head, 1 run full again, sliding in straight and flicked square
Willey to Stoinis, 2 runs pitched up straight and worked off the pads for a couple through midwicket
Willey to Stoinis, no run banged in, Stoinis swivels on the pull but picks out the man on the ring
Willey to Stoinis, FOUR runs oof, he's hit that, full in the slot to drive, Stoinis steps out and fair dinkums it straight back past mid-off for four!
Tom Curran to Head, no run slanted across, nice and full and plunked to mid-off coming forwards
Tom Curran to Head, 1 run length ball, slightly wide and Head flays an angled bat for one into the covers
Tom Curran to Stoinis, no run mistimed, maybe a slower delivery from Curran, driven uppishly but short of mid-off
Tom Curran to Stoinis, FOUR runs this was definitely slower, out the back of the hand... but dispatched at full speed back down the ground, a flat mow that almost goes all the way at long-on!
Tom Curran to Stoinis, 1 run good length and worked into the leg side
Tom Curran to Head, no run puts it on a length, chopped into the covers
Ali to Stoinis, 2 runs starts nicely, sliding on to hit the outside edge but it runs wide of slip for a couple
Ali to Stoinis, no run tossed up and pushed down the track
Ali to Stoinis, FOUR runs pushed through a little too straight, Stoinis sweeps and sends it fizzing away to deep backward square leg - raising the Australia 50 in the process
Ali to Stoinis, no run pushed through outside off and he nearly gets in a tangle trying to sweep again
Ali to Stoinis, no run floated up and defended coming forwards

Ali to Stoinis, SIX runs oh, that's a whopper! Stoinis goes downtown for some hang time! Skips to the pitch and absolutely wallops the ball into the second tier of the stand... Perth Stadium's biggest hit to date
Tom Curran to Head, 1 run on the pads and clipped through square leg
Tom Curran to Stoinis, no run good line from Curran, gets this to straighten a touch as Stoinis pushes at it and is beaten
Tom Curran to Stoinis, no run fuller, played with a straight bat into the covers
Tom Curran to Stoinis, no run length, maybe taking the pace off, Stoinis goes across and tries to flick to leg, gets a leading edge
Tom Curran to Stoinis, 1 run banged in, 131kph and pulled through square leg for a single
Tom Curran to Head, 2 runs strays on to the pads and clipped for a couple
Rashid to Stoinis, no run floated up and pulled aggressively but straight to midwicket
Rashid to Stoinis, FOUR runs full and flighted, crunched through the covers, more power from Stoin Cold Stoinis!
Rashid to Stoinis, no run teasing, tossed up and spinning through
Rashid to Stoinis, 1 run comes forward and pushes this down the ground
Rashid to Head, 1 run flat and angled across outside off, Head rocks back to crunch the ball to mid-off
Rashid to Stoinis, 3 runs flung up outside off, spinning away as Stoinis drops back and cuts a couple through cover point
Ball to Stoinis, no run full outside off and driven firmly to mid-off
Ball to Stoinis, 1 run length, 139kph from Ball, dropped softly into the off side and they hustle through as Roy comes in for a shy at the non-striker's end
Ball to Head, no run round the wicket, good wheels as he pushes up to 143kph and Head swings at it in vain
Ball to Head, no run back of a length over off stump, Head pulls and gets a thick bottom edge, Buttler does well to stop it scooting past him
Ball to Head, FOUR runs shortish, rising outside off, fended away off the back foot... and it races away fine of third man for four, bringing up the fifty stand
Ball to Head, 1 run angled in back of a length, 142kph and pulled this time, just one through midwicket
Rashid to Head, no run dragged down but Head swats it straight back to the bowler
Rashid to Head, 1 run tossed up, uses the feet and works one through midwicket
Rashid to Stoinis, no run looped up on off stump, flicked to midwicket
Rashid to Stoinis, no run tossed up nice and slow, Stoinis comes down but picks out midwicket again
Rashid to Stoinis, no run pushed through, driven and it comes off the inside half of the bat
Rashid to Stoinis, 1 run tossed up on the stumps, Stoinis goes deep in the crease and clips one in front of square on the leg side
Ball to Stoinis, no run full outside off, Stoinis climbs into drive but sends it along the carpet to mid-off
Ball to Stoinis, SIX runs all the way over third man! Short and wide and he frees the arms, uses the pace and dumps it beyond the ropes
Ball to Stoinis, no run short of a length, defended on off
Ball to Stoinis, no run ooh, close to the outside edge, 142kph in the corridor and Stoinis nearly pays for a flat-footed flirt
Ball to Stoinis, no run short and wide but he's off balance trying to hammer a cut and again fails to connect

Ball to Stoinis, OUT knocked into the covers, called through for a tight single, there's a direct hit and this could be tight... although they then try to pinch a second on the ricochet. It goes up to the third umpire and Head is struggling here, there's only a frame or two in it, but he's not managed to get his bat over the line - this is going to be out! Morgan was the fielder, he pretty much hit the bails wi
Rashid to Stoinis, 1 run flighted, Stoinis stands tall and pushes down the ground to long-on

Rashid to Smith, no run nicely bowled, draws him forward and Buttler whips off the bails, has he been stumped first ball?! England seem fairly confident, Smith was off balance reaching forwards, but it looks like he had some boot behind the line... Yes, Dharmasena takes several looks at it, but Smith is okay
Rashid to Smith, no run flighted, the googly, I think, hits the splice and rolls in the leg side, Stoinis has to scramble back for his ground
Rashid to Smith, no run tosses up another Bosie and Smith defends from the crease
Rashid to Smith, no run floated full around off stump, punched into the covers
Rashid to Smith, no run flighted, dipping on off and driven firmly but straight to cover
Ball to Stoinis, no run comes across and defends on off stump
Ball to Stoinis, no run fullish, angled in and played back to the bowler
Ball to Stoinis, 1 run back of a length outside off, Stoinis waits in the crease and drops the ball down behind square for one
Ball to Smith, no run fired in straight, blocked back to the bowler
Ball to Smith, 1 run pitched up and driven, off the outer half of the bat down to third man
Ball to Stoinis, no run on the stumps, 140kph and Stoinis is happy to defend
Rashid to Smith, 3 runs down the track, whipped supremely out through deep midwicket, and gathered just inside the rope
Rashid to Stoinis, no run googly to resume, tight to off stump and stoutly defended
Rashid to Stoinis, 1 run sliding down the leg side, tucked out to square leg to spare Rashid a wide
Rashid to Smith, 1 run wafted out to long-on with a big stride
Rashid to Stoinis, 1 run worked into the covers
Rashid to Smith, no run onto the front foot, calmly pressed to short cover
Ball to Stoinis, no run leaning forward and dabbed to point
Ball to Stoinis, 1 run outside off, nurdled down to third man
Ball to Smith, 1 run opens the face and glides down to third man once again
Ball to Stoinis, 1 wide banged in short, gets up sharply, but there's no reaching that one
Ball to Stoinis, no run full length, attacking the base of the stumps, fended away
Ball to Stoinis, no run up on the toes, attempted glide through third man
Ball to Stoinis, no run wider on the crease, angled into the stumps, good restrictive delivery
Rashid to Smith, no run tossed up and drilled into the covers
Rashid to Smith, 1 run finds the gap this time
Rashid to Stoinis, 1 run tucked into the leg side and Stoinis gallops through for a fine fifty
Rashid to Smith, 1 run worked into the gap at long-on
Rashid to Stoinis, 1 run driven into the covers once again
Rashid to Smith, no run eased out to cover. Rashid doing a good job of putting a handbrake on these middle overs
Ali to Stoinis, 1 run tossed up, on the toes, tapped down to long-on
Ali to Smith, no run poked out to cover
Ali to Smith, no run short midwicket intercepts
Ali to Smith, 1 run worked out to the leg side, still content to deal in singles
Ali to Stoinis, 1 run full length and worked down the ground once more
Ali to Smith, 1 run flipped into the leg side, a servicably restrictive over
Rashid to Smith, 1 run finds the gap in the covers once more
Rashid to Stoinis, no run back of a length and drilled back at the bowler
Rashid to Stoinis, FOUR runs shorter, wider, a rare loose one, and slammed to the point fence. No missing out there!
Rashid to Stoinis, SIX runs here we go! This is getting lively again, pounded high and handsome over long-on, picking the wrong'un, and the wrong'un gets picked out of the stands!
Rashid to Stoinis, no run faster and flatter outside off, misses out on the cut
Rashid to Stoinis, no run nudged to short midwicket
Ali to Smith, no run twirled onto a good length outside off, worked to mid-on
Ali to Smith, 1 run back of a length, punched up to long-on
Ali to Stoinis, 1 run stretching forward, eased into the covers
Ali to Marsh, no run on the back foot, punched up to mid-on
Ali to Marsh, 1 run bashed out to deep cover
Rashid to Marsh, no run punched into the covers
Rashid to Marsh, FOUR runs thumped down the ground, in the slot and met with a free-wheeling blade. Top boshing
Rashid to Marsh, 1 run cracked into the covers, up on the toes
Rashid to Stoinis, 1 run sliding onto leg stump, worked square
Rashid to Marsh, 1 run looped up, pushed to cover
Rashid to Stoinis, no run squeezed back to the bowler from a full length
Ali to Marsh, FOUR runs tossed up outside off, and slapped hard through gully. Came largely off a thick edge, but the outfield is rapid and there's no cutting that off
Ali to Marsh, no run leaning forward to defend
Ali to Marsh, no run standing tall on the back foot, and punched to mid-on
Ali to Marsh, 2 runs wafted through the off side with a roll of the wrists
Ali to Maxwell, no run looped up, deflected into the off side.
Ball to Stoinis, no run wide on the crease, full length, defended to cover
Ball to Stoinis, no run nipping off the deck, back into the right hander. Good ball, Ball
Ball to Stoinis, no run outside off, an attempted slash through the off side, but no contact this time
Ball to Stoinis, no run full again, met with a measured drive to mid-off
Ball to Stoinis, 2 runs shorter, and slapped uppishly into no-man's land at deep midwicket
Ball to Stoinis, no run on the back foot, defended into the covers, that's a decent over to bring us to the halfway mark with the game very much in the balance
Ali to Maxwell, no run on the back foot, and clipped to the leg side
Ali to Maxwell, no run striding onto the front foot
Ali to Maxwell, 1 run width, and cracked into the covers
Ali to Stoinis, 2 runs reverses the hands, dabbed gently into the gap behind square on the off side
Ali to Stoinis, no run more flight, teasing length outside off, pushed back to the bowler
Ali to Stoinis, no run tight line, nudged into the leg side off the front foot
Ball to Maxwell, no run steps across the stumps to guide a drive into the covers
Ball to Maxwell, FOUR runs full length, pumped into the deep, where Moeen swoops with one hand in an attempt to hurry the second run and gives away the boundary instead! Whoops
Ball to Maxwell, no run stands tall in defence, and pushed back down the pitch
Ball to Maxwell, 1 run up on the toes to deep cover, and huge ironic cheers as Moeen gathers properly this time and sends in the return
Ball to Stoinis, no run on the back foot, good lift off the deck, defended back to the bowler
Ball to Stoinis, 1 run hopping across the stumps and tucked into the leg side
Ali to Stoinis, no run on the back foot, pinged hard back to the bowler who gathers on his knees
Ali to Stoinis, 1 run tight line on middle and off, Stoinis goes back and across to defend
Ali to Maxwell, no run tidy line and length again, nothing for the batsman to work with
Ali to Maxwell, 2 runs slightly leg-sided, and urgently flicked into the gap behind square. Good running
Ali to Maxwell, SIX runs plants the front foot, and that's up, up and away! Tossed up, tempting the aggression, but expertly executed
Ali to Maxwell, 1 run on the toes, whipped to leg
Ball to Maxwell, no run extra nip off the deck, thuds into the thigh pad
Ball to Maxwell, no run blocked back down the pitch
Ball to Maxwell, FOUR runs oh, well played, banged in short, Maxwell unfurls the ramp and Buttler can't haul that one in
Ball to Maxwell, 1 run tapped into the covers to keep the scoreboard moving
Ball to Stoinis, 1 run back of a length, dabbed down into the crease
Ball to Maxwell, 1 run attempted pull out through the leg side
Ali to Maxwell, 1 run looped onto the toes, tapped out to midwicket
Ali to Stoinis, 1 run reverses the hands, nearly beaten by a good bit of tight bowling from Moeen, but gets enough bat to draw a tumbling stop from Rashid at backward point
Ali to Maxwell, 1 run dabbed into the off side
Ali to Stoinis, 1 run tossed up, nurdled down to long on
Ali to Maxwell, 2 runs outside off, slashed out to deep point
Ali to Maxwell, 1 run gathered at backward square leg
Willey to Maxwell, no run well bowled, tight line from round the wicket, drawing a solid back-foot block
Willey to Maxwell, 1 run on the hips, whipped behind square
Willey to Stoinis, no run on the back foot, and defended back down the pitch
Willey to Stoinis, 1 wide sliding past the leg stump
Willey to Stoinis, no run tight line and defended
Willey to Stoinis, no run a fierce yorker, excellent pace and nearly squeezes through
Willey to Stoinis, 1 run opens the face, guides a single down to third man
Rashid to Stoinis, no run tossed up outside off, flat-batted back to the bowler
Rashid to Stoinis, SIX runs up and over... and over the head of long-off! It teased the man on the rope, but just kept on going!
Rashid to Stoinis, no run thrashed back at the bowler, who gathers in his followthrough
Rashid to Stoinis, 1 run dragged out to deep midwicket
Rashid to Maxwell, no run turning into the toes, tucked to midwicket
Rashid to Maxwell, no run looped up again, a good tight finish but Australia made some good dents in that over
Willey to Stoinis, no run angled into the toes, flicked to the leg side
Willey to Stoinis, 1 run full length, stabbed into the covers and gathered with a slide
Willey to Maxwell, 1 run full length again, dug out into the leg side for another jogged single. Australia milking it nicely at the moment
Willey to Stoinis, 2 runs width, and cut down to third man
Willey to Stoinis, no run tapped out to point
Willey to Stoinis, 1 run up comes the fifty stand with another chiselled single, and that will also be drinks
Rashid to Stoinis, 1 run floated up on off, Stoinis is down early to sweep through square
Rashid to Maxwell, no run pushed through, Maxwell opens the face and steers towards point
Rashid to Maxwell, no run tossed up, slow legbreak which Maxwell dabs down but again it's too tight for one
Rashid to Maxwell, FOUR runs outrageous! Reverse-swatted over backward point for four! A crazy golf shot, chipped over the infield and it bounces away, no one out there so a safe option
Rashid to Maxwell, 1 run flighted, worked into the leg side for one
Willey to Maxwell, no run fired in full, hitting the pads as Maxwell hangs back on leg stump
Willey to Maxwell, no run length on the stumps, tapped away
Willey to Maxwell, no run Willey is bowling round the wicket, fired in around the line of off, defended square
Willey to Maxwell, no run full, 132kph and Maxwell is cramped again, misses with a flick and it rolls away off the pads
Willey to Maxwell, no run angled in with the arm, worked to the on side
Willey to Maxwell, no run low full toss, bunted towards cover - and that's a maiden for Willey
Rashid to Paine, no run floats up the googly, slips inside the bat to hit the front pad
Rashid to Paine, 1 run flighted, slow and loopy and Paine drive, just gets it past Rashid diving to his right
Rashid to Maxwell, no run full on off, Maxwell drives to extra cover

Rashid to Maxwell, 1 run dragged down and Maxwell nearly comes a cropper, pancake-flipped to leg but it comes off the toe of the bat and loops much squarer than intended, Morgan can't quite get there from midwicket
Rashid to Paine, no run lobbed up straight and tucked to leg
Rashid to Paine, no run pushed through, Paine taps into the covers - four dots in the over
Tom Curran to Maxwell, 1 wide 130kph, sliding down the leg side first up
Tom Curran to Maxwell, OUT rapped on the pads, nibbling in sharply... Buttler is appealing desperately for lbw and England decide to review
Tom Curran to Starc, no run lets go a full toss, Starc bunts it back to the bowler

Tom Curran to Starc, OUT angled across, nips late and takes the edge - Buttler swallows it going low to his left! Curran leaps to punch the air, brilliant bit of bowling and a catch to match! He was trying to tuck to leg when he needed to play straight, Starc heads off with Daddles for company and Australia are seven down, the chase getting trickier and trickier
Tom Curran to Tye, FOUR runs pitched up and driven, gets a chunk of inside edge on it and the ball races away for four! Meaty swing and it outruns mid-on
Tom Curran to Tye, 1 run length outside off, Tye hammers into the deep, just one as the cover sweeper gives chase
Tom Curran to Paine, no run length, shaping away at 135kph - looks like Curran is reversing it - and Paine leaves alone
Ali to Tye, no run length ball, spinning in and tapped away hanging back on leg stump
Ali to Tye, 1 run lobbed up, clubbed down the ground for one to long-on
Ali to Paine, no run darted in the stumps, Paine jabs to midwicket
Ali to Paine, no run pushed through on the stumps and again Paine can't get it past the man on the leg side
Ali to Paine, no run flat on the stumps, Paine backs away to cut but sends a thick edge to backward point
Ali to Paine, no run wicket-to-wicket, fired in and punched back to the bowler - just one off the over
Tom Curran to Tye, no run fullish around off stump, slower delivery but Tye doesn't fall into the trap, defended solidly
Tom Curran to Tye, no run pitched up and shaping in, 134kph and Tye crunches it along the ground to mid-on
Tom Curran to Tye, no run dug in short, he rocks back to try and cut but fails to lay bat on it - possibly too close for the shot

Tom Curran to Tye, 2 runs dropped! Hoicked leg side, Tye goes after the slower ball and he sends it high towards deep square leg, Bairstow is usually a good man to have under one of these but he's already shelled a catch today and can't hold on diving forwards! Looks like he overran it slightly
Tom Curran to Tye, no run oof, beats the bat, rising off a length as Tye hangs back

Tom Curran to Tye, 2 leg byes pitched up, goes for the yorker, Tye shuffles across and deflects it fine... Curran appeals for lbw but the umpire turns him down again. England don't review this time, must have been heading down leg
Ali to Paine, 1 leg bye pushed through, Paine tries to reverse-paddle this with the back of the bat, misses and it deflects away off Buttler's gloves
Ali to Zampa, 1 run flighted, Zampa comes across and dabs into the covers for one to get going
Ali to Paine, no run pushed through and worked down to the leg side
Ali to Paine, 2 runs flat on the stumps, Paine is on one knee and laps it over his shoulder, using the pace and gets it towards fine leg for a couple
Ali to Paine, 1 run tossed up and worked into a gap for one more

Tom Curran to Paine, no run nipbacker on a length, hit on the back pad and again Curran gets no joy from Simon Fry... England don't review, maybe a touch high? He was coming down the pitch and struck above the knee
Tom Curran to Paine, 1 run length ball, Paine pokes into a gap in the covers
Tom Curran to Zampa, no run good length around off, defended
Tom Curran to Zampa, no run fuller, leg side and it thuds into the pads as Zampa hangs back
Tom Curran to Zampa, 1 run short ball, shovelled around the corner towards fine leg
Tom Curran to Paine, 1 run full outside off, 135kph and driven in front of mid-off for one
Ali to Paine, no run pushed through outside off and sliced off the back foot towards point
Ali to Paine, no run pushed through and tucked to the leg side, Zampa sets off before being sent back, Morgan swoops on it but he makes his ground!
Ali to Paine, 2 runs touch short and Paine cuts firmly, behind the man in the deep and they get a couple
Ali to Paine, 1 run dropped! Paine tried to hit out and plopped it down the ground towards long-on, where Hales grasses a low chance! You expect those to be taken... Paine survives, could be crucial
Ali to Zampa, 1 run angled in and nudged down the ground to Hales, gets a cheer for fielding
Ali to Paine, 1 run short, swatted down to long-on again... It's following Hales
Willey to Paine, no run round the wicket, full around off and driven to cover
Willey to Paine, 2 runs pitched up, gets this away behind point into a gap for two
Willey to Paine, 1 run length ball, 134kph outside off, Paine reaches for it and thick-edges one to third man
Willey to Zampa, no run fires in the attempted yorker, Zampa digs it out on to his front foot
Willey to Zampa, 1 run full length, 132kph and dinked through the covers for one
Willey to Paine, no run fired in on off, looking for reverse swing, defended back to the bowler
Ball to Zampa, no run short of a length and chopped into the covers as Zampa hangs back
Ball to Zampa, 1 run slower ball, pulled from outside off towards deep midwicket
Ball to Paine, 1 run length, cutting his fingers over it again, Paine runs one to third man
Ball to Zampa, FOUR runs width and slashed towards third man, where Moeen is wrong-footed by the spin and it skips for four! Poor fielding and it gifts a vital boundary to the Australia cause
Ball to Zampa, 1 run fullish and driven aerilly through the covers
Ball to Paine, 1 run back of a length over the stumps, Paine turns it around the corner, looking for two to deep backward square - but they settle for the single, Paine keeping the strike
Willey to Paine, no run round the wicket, pitched up on off and Paine blocks
Willey to Paine, no run tight stuff from Willey, 132kph on middle and off and tapped to the leg side
Willey to Paine, no run fired in, 138kph and again there's no width to play with, Paine pushes into the covers
Willey to Paine, 1 run short of a length, rising up on to the hip for Paine to tuck one square

Willey to Zampa, no run over the wicket, full and straight, hit on the toe - given! Zampa calls for the review, as he has to... Just a matter of where it pitched, from the looks of it, maybe a touch leg side... Yes, pitched outside leg, so the decision is overturned! Cheers of relief around the ground, Zampa survives!
Willey to Zampa, no run full outside off, chopped into the covers - another dot, Willey denied a wicket but he dries up the runs
Ball to Paine, 1 run short ball, taking the pace off, Paine pulls it around the corner for one
Ball to Zampa, no run good length on off, Zampa pushes circumspectly to extra cover
Ball to Zampa, 1 run banged in, Zampa heaves down the ground, in the air but it won't carry to long-on running in

Ball to Paine, FOUR runs dug in and smashed to the boundary! Slower-ball bouncer from Ball but it sits up invitingly and Paine swivels to slam it through deep backward square leg and perk up the crowd once more!
Ball to Paine, 1 run angled in and dabbed to the leg side for the single
Ball to Zampa, no run hits a length, Zampa shows it straight bat
Tom Curran to Paine, no run slower ball, on middle and leg, Paine tries to work across the line but only pops it back down the track off the splice
Tom Curran to Paine, 1 run outside off, again taking the pace off, runs this down to third man
Tom Curran to Hazlewood, no run round the wicket, swerving away from back of a length, play and a miss
Tom Curran to Hazlewood, no run fuller, poked square and they won't chance a single to point
Tom Curran to Hazlewood, no run back-of-the-hand slower ball, wide of the stumps, Hazlewood prods and misses
Ball to Paine, no run slower-ball bouncer again, Paine hammers a pull to deep square leg... and declines the single
Ball to Paine, no run Paine backs away to leg, Ball fires in a cutter, gets a play-and-miss as Buttler tumbles to gather
Ball to Paine, FOUR runs short, taking the pace off, Paine swings hard and thick-edges four to third man! Came off the toe, in fact, and scuttles fine past the man down there

Ball to Paine, SIX runs full and straight - RAMPED FOR SIX!!! What a shot, skill and guts from Paine! Ball missed the yorker and he got the lap away perfectly to sail all the way over the rope at fine leg!
Ball to Paine, no run dug on short, Paine pulls square and again declines one
Ball to Paine, 1 run finishes with another slow bouncer, pulled to fine leg for one to keep Paine on strike
Tom Curran to Paine, no run full, fast, swerving in and dug out on off stump into the covers - dot ball
"Will we get the inflatable four fingers up for this ending?" wonders Simon. I suspect England might get a hand gesture or two...
England won by 12 runs
Player of the match is Tom Curran, ENG
